description.p: An Identification_of_property is a relationship between a Physical_quantity_instance and a maths_value that identifies the Physical_quantity_instance.
The Scale for the identification is specified by a Scale_for_identification_of_property.

note.p: The entity type Identification_of_property defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type property_quantification defined in ISO 15926-2.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_instance that is the temperature instance identified as 20 degrees Celsius; and
the maths_value that is the real number 20,

example.p: that indicates the temperature instance is identified by the maths value, is an Identification_of_property.

explicit.name: identifier
explicit.description: a maths_value that identifies the property.

description.p: A Scale is a 1-1 mapping from a Physical_quantity_space to a Maths_space that is used to identify instances of Physical_quantity_instance.
A Scale specifies the unit of measure, the coordinate system, and any encoding method that is used to identify members of the Physical_quantity_space.

note.p: The entity type Scale defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type scale defined in ISO 15926-2.

The entity type Scale defined in this part of ISO 10303 is interpreted on to the entity type maths_space_context defined in ISO 10303-51. The details of the units of measure and coordinate system are provided by this interpretation.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_space that is temperature; and
the Maths_space that is the real interval bounded below by -273.17,

example.p: that indicates each temperature instance within the Physical_quantity_space is uniquely identified by a real value within the Maths_space, and that is called 'Celsius', is a Scale.

explicit.name: identifier
explicit.description: the Maths_space that has the property mapped to it.

explicit.name: property
explicit.description: the Physical_quantity_space that is mapped to the identifier.

description.p: A Scale_for_identification_of_property is relationship between an Identification_of_property and a Scale that indicates the Scale is used to interpret the Identification_of_property.

note.p: The entity type Scale_for_identification_of_property defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to a classification relationship in ISO 15926-2 between the entity types property_quantification and scale.

ul.li: the Identification_of_property that assigns the number 20 to the temperature during test T_1234; and

example.p: that indicates the number 20 identifies the property with respect to the scale, is a Scale_for_identification_of_property.

explicit.name: identification
explicit.description: the Identification_of_property and a Identification_of_property that is interpreted with respect to the scale.

explicit.name: scale
explicit.description: the Scale that defines the interpretation of the identification.
